newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Amgen trades lower.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Amgen trades lower.

text.p: Amgen Inc was trading at 54 in after-hours trading, down from 55-1/16 at the close, traders said Friday.
The company said earlier in the day that it planned to file for Food and Drug Administration approval of its Stem Cell Factor in the next few months.

It said phase three clinical trials showed positive results for its factor when tested in breast cancer patients receiving chemotherapy. Intel Corp was down at 144-1/8 from the closing quote of 144-1/2, while Microsoft Corp was higher at 84-1/2 against the close's 84-1/4, one trader said.

The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 109,000 shares against 277,500 on Thursday. It said there was no session two, while the day before the session had a volume of 987,800 shares.
